      • ChannelHolder

        public ChannelHolder(TimeSeriesBlock inbuf,
             int secDepth,
             int minRecs,
             java.lang.Class defSub,
             int defWaitSec)
        Creates a new instance of ChannelHolder
        Parameters:
        inbuf - The time series block to use to model this holder for seedname, etc
        secDepth - the depth in seconds for the list of blocks
        minRecs - The minimum number of records to hold in the list of recent data
        defSub - the default subscriber class to use to create new instances of the output portion
        defWaitSec - How long to wait for the next data before timeing out and moving on

      • addData

        public final void addData(TimeSeriesBlock inbuf)
        this routine adds a bit of timeseries to this channels applying the maxsec rules and sends any data to the subscribers.
        1) If the block is maxsec old than current newest block it is discarded.
        2) If the list of blocks is null, then it is created along with the default Subscriber
        3) If # used blocks on list = list size, a new block is created.
        4) The block is loaded() onto the next cleared block.
        5) The blocks are sorted into order
        6) If the newest block on the list is older than the oldest by maxsec, the list is purged by clearing any blocks which are now too old.
        7) for each subscriber to this ChannelHolder we attempt to get the next desired block for that subscriber and waittime. If any are found they are sent to the subscriber. (Desired is the time next wanted, waittime is how long the wait will be relative to the 'newest' block in list. When the older blocks are newer by more than waittime, they are forwarded. )
        Parameters:
        inbuf - The timeseries buffer to add to this channel

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()

      • addMSData

        public static void addMSData(TimeSeriesBlock buf,
             int secDepth,
             int minRecs)
        add any MiniSeed buffer to the current list of ChannelHolders
        Parameters:
        buf - A buffer of bytes of MiniSeed data in raw form
        secDepth - The depth in seconds of this ChannelHolder
        minRecs - The minimum number of records to hold (regardless of secDepth
